noun.description: A corpse supposed, in European folklore, to leave its grave at night to drink the blood of the living by biting their necks with long pointed canine teeth.
A small bat that feeds on the blood of mammals or birds using its two sharp incisor teeth and anticoagulant saliva, found mainly in tropical America.

origin: Mid 18th century: from French, from Hungarian vampir, perhaps from Turkish uber witch.
